oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Pauline Nuzzolezze Staiano (class of 1952) Photo Album
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Gross, Rosemary Sheprow
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Photo album given as a gift to Pauline Nuzzolezze Staiano, class of 1952, from her roommate Rosemary Sheprow Gross, class of 1952. It includes many photographs of their time at the New Paltz (New York) State Teachers College. There are photographs taken outside the Old Main building on campus, at the annual New Paltz Lantern Night, and at other school events. Also includes photographs of the Theta Phi Sorority. Many other photographs were taken around the town of New Paltz and the surrounding areas. The photo album cover is decorated with a flocked graphic of the letters NPSTC in orange surrounded by a blue diamond shaped border.

oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Gosline scrapbook
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Eighty-five page scrapbook created by Laura Abigail (Abbie) Gosline during her time at the State Normal School at New Paltz, N.Y. from 1915-1917. It includes accounts of parties and events that occurred while she was in school. Pages also include event programs, invitations to parties and graduations, school assignments and other memorabilia of her time in New Paltz. After graduation, Abbie obtained a position as a teacher in the primary department at The Union Free School in Farmingdale, New York on Long Island. There, she was also responsible for the school library.

oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Second Mohonk Conference on the Negro Question held at Lake Mohonk, Ulster County, New York, June 3, 4, 5, 1891
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Lake Mohonk Conference on the Negro Question
oai_dc:dc.dc:publisher: Boston : G.H. Ellis, 1891
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: The proceedings of a conference held at Lake Mohonk in June, 1891, the second annual conference of two. Attendees included statesmen, leaders in education and leaders in the ministry. The focus of the conference was on the current situation of the African-American population and the means through which improvement in that situation might be achieved. Much of the discussion revolved around the need for education to be provided for all people, with particular emphasis on training as teachers and ministers.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: African Americans--Congresses
oai_dc:dc.dc:coverage: New Paltz - Ulster County - New York
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: African Americans; Government; Education; Religion;
